channel.title: Java Transition
channel.description:
I am some-what comfortable with Java. I can create a lot of basic applications, outputting them onto a command prompt. I'm finding it pretty hard to learn rendering, painting graphics onto a canvas, and stuff like that. I can create a basic JFrame with no problem, but after that, I get stuck.
Any thoughts on ways I can transition my way of learning to GUI?
If that makes any sense.

item.title: Java Transition
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Google is your friend.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Transition
item.dc:creator: @Techkid Techkid
item.description:
@Techkid wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:3, topic:537054”][quote author=Kiryn link=topic=655870.msg4389904#msg4389904 date=1387083730]
you can start out by overriding the paint method and then move on to more advanced ways of painting an image
[/quote]
I believe he means an actual GUI (Swing), not graphics/graphics2d.[/quote]
Is there any links to tutorials on this?

Read full topic
